title: Man's Cap, late 16th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery on linen foundation, metal spangles
Technique: embroidered in split, back and couching stitches on plain weave foundation
dimensions: H x diam: 20 x 19 cm (7 7/8 x 7 1/2 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: A man's conical cap with turned up cuff of off-white linen, embroidered in a pattern of  rainbows hovering over clouds with rain falling on snails and caterpillars, in blue, green, yellow, red and pink silk and silver metallic threads.

tombstone.epitaph:
Man's Cap, late 16th century.
late 16th century. Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery on linen foundation, metal spangles
Technique: embroidered in split, back and couching stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-53-11.
